required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects Of DBS Of Subthalamıc Nucleus On Functionality In Patıents With Parkinson's Disease: Short-Term Results
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects Of Deep Brain Stimulation Of Subthalamıc Nucleus On Pulmonary Function Tests and Functionality In Patıents With Parkinson's Disease: Short Term Results

brief_summary.textblock: Parkinson's disease is a progressive chronic neurodegenerative disease. In cases where drug treatment is insufficient and drug use is not possible due to drug side effects, highly effective and low-risk surgical treatment options could be used. In Parkinson's Disease; findings such as chest wall rigidity and weakness of the respiratory muscle strength occur. The aim of this study was to determine the effect of preop and postop DBS surgery on respiratory muscle strength, respiratory function and physical performance in patients with Parkinson's disease.

detailed_description.textblock: In the study, at least 10 patients with Parkinson's disease who had DBS surgery in Mustafa Kemal University Research and Practice Hospital, Department of Brain and Nerve Surgery will be evaluated. Demographic-physical features, pulmonary functions, respiratory muscle strength, exercise capacity, functionality, and muscle strength will be evaluated

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Functional exercise capacity at 3 months(Pre-op,Post-op Off, Post-op 1. month, Post-op 3. Month), an average of 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pulmonary functions at 3 months(Pre-op,Post-op Off, Post-op 1. month, Post-op 3. Month), an average of 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inspiratory and expiratory muscle strength (MIP, MEP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Inspiratory and expiratory muscle strength (MIP, MEP) at 3 months(Pre-op,Post-op Off, Post-op 1. month, Post-op 3. Month), an average of 3 months
Change from Peripheral muscle strength at 3 months(Pre-op,Post-op Off, Post-op 1. month, Post-op 3. Month), an average of 3 months
Change from Peripheral muscle strength at 3 months(Pre-op,Post-op Off, Post-op 1. month, Post-op 3. Month), an average of 3 months

arm_group.description: MIP and MEP Respiratory Function Test Strength Test

intervention.description: Pre-op, Post-op of, 1 month after surgery, 3 months after surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lack of any neurological disease other than Parkinson's
- DBS surgery to be performed in the STN region
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced cognitive impairment
- Patients with pulmonary, neurological and orthopedic diseases affecting functionalities
- Pregnancy
- Patients in whom the stimulation was canceled due to infection after surgery.

overall_official.affiliation: Gazi University Faculty of Health Science Department of Physical Therapy
Hatay Mustafa Kemal University School of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation
Hatay Mustafa Kemal University Department of Neurosurgery

reference.citation: Stemper B, Beric A, Welsch G, Haendl T, Sterio D, Hilz MJ. Deep brain stimulation improves orthostatic regulation of patients with Parkinson disease. Neurology. 2006 Nov 28;67(10):1781-5.

Trachani E, Constantoyannis C, Sirrou V, Kefalopoulou Z, Markaki E, Chroni E. Effects of subthalamic nucleus deep brain stimulation on sweating function in Parkinson's disease. Clin Neurol Neurosurg. 2010 Apr;112(3):213-7. doi: 10.1016/j.clineuro.2009.11.015. Epub 2009 Dec 22.

Hyam JA, Brittain JS, Paterson DJ, Davies RJ, Aziz TZ, Green AL. Controlling the lungs via the brain: a novel neurosurgical method to improve lung function in humans. Neurosurgery. 2012 Feb;70(2):469-77; discussion 477-8. doi: 10.1227/NEU.0b013e318231d789.
